title: How to Always Disable Dark Mode for Email Body in Thunderbird 128.10.0esr?
content:
Hello,

The latest version, 128.10.0esr, was recently released, and one of the changes is:

Changed color override defaults with high contrast mode on macOS and Linux

https://www.thunderbird.net/en-US/thunderbird/128.10.0esr/releasenotes/?uri=/thunderbird/releasenotes/&locale=en-US&version=128.10.0&channel=esr&os=Darwin&buildid=20250425031534

I use dark mode, but I prefer to view the email body in light mode, as this is typically the sender‚Äôs default formatting. To achieve this, I previously configured: ‚Ä¢ Settings ‚Üí General ‚Üí Fonts & Colors ‚Üí Colors ‚Ä¢ Set Text to black and Background to white ‚Ä¢ Enabled ‚ÄúOverride the colors specified by the content with my selections above:‚Äù and set it to ‚ÄúOnly with High Contrast themes‚Äù

However, since this update, this setting no longer works. Now, the only workaround is to manually click the ‚ÄúTurn dark mode off‚Äù button for each email, which does work. But it‚Äôs inconvenient to do this every time.

Is there a way to disable dark mode for all email bodies by default, so I don‚Äôt need to click the button each time?

Thank you!

Yours,
creator: NoSyu

title: Email replies
content: I have just started using [and donated to], Thunderbird on this newer PC. However, I cannot reply to emails, getting an error message stating that the sending failed because the SMTP server timed out. This happens even if I type just one letter as a reply and hit send. I have been using Thunderbird for a couple of years on my other recalcitrant PC, and have never had this problem. I have checked and all settings are exactly the same on both computers, same security programs, everything. Some internet articles say that it could be the security system, I disabled that, but the problem persists. What is going on? So naturally, if I need to reply to you, I will have to use the other computer, which randomly shuts down at inopportune times. Regards, Theo Beeltje.

title: TB 138 no longer handles multiple CalDav accounts with (baikal) server
content:
We've been using Thunderbird on Windows for quite some time to sync multiple calendars and address books with our ba√Økal CalDav server. Recently (since 138?) Thunderbird is failing to handle multiple calendar accounts.

Anonymized description of the situation:

  • Let's say that our ba√Økal caldav server resides at https://abc.com
  • There are two user accounts at this ba√Økal server: user1@abc.com and user2@def.org (Notice that these two users have different domain names and tld's)
  • Of late, only the first caldav account (user1@abc.com) is handled. The second caldav account (user2@def.org) ran out of sync.
  • On the mobile phones, using davx5, all calendar accounts sync perfectly. So nothing is off with the ba√Økal server.
  • After removing the calendar(s) associated with user2@def.org from Thunderbird, it is not possible to add these again. After entering the e-mail address (user2@def.org) and the correct url of the caldav server, it looks like the user is overriden by user1@abc.com. There is also no dialogue asking for the password of user2@def.org.

My guesses:

  • Either TB 138 - silently - insists in caldav user accounts having the same domain.tld as the server
  • Or TB 138 somehow overrides/overwrites an alternative e-mail address with the one already present, hence the missing password dialogue

Anyone else experiencing this?
creator: stephan35

title: Thunderbird cannot find my profile
content:
I had to reinstall Fedora 42 on my Dell XPS 9315. I reinstalled Thunderbird, but it won't open, saying it cannot find my profile. How do I tell the new TB installation where my profile is?

At /home/eric/.var/app/org.mozilla.Thunderbird/.thunderbird,my profiles.ini file looks like this:

[General] StartWithLastProfile=1 Version=2

[Profile1] Name=default IsRelative=1 Path=z663dkmf.default-release Default=1

[Profile0] Name=default-release IsRelative=1 Path=grykcnt2.default-release

[InstallFA9DEAB4CC8E0E14] Default=/home/eric/.var/app/org.mozilla.Thunderbird/.thunderbird/z663dkmf.default-release Locked=1

[Profile2] Name=Default User IsRelative=0 Path=/home/eric/.var/app/org.mozilla.Thunderbird/.thunderbird/z663dkmf.default-release == There's also an installs.ini file:

[FA9DEAB4CC8E0E14] Default=/home/eric/.var/app/org.mozilla.Thunderbird/.thunderbird/z663dkmf.default-release Locked=1

title: Sent emails not being received - Fasthost said my messages were being registered as spam by my own server
content:
So Thunderbird auto updated last Tuesday and although I was then sending emails as normal with no error codes and them still showing as sent - they weren't received. I spoke to Fasthost who said my messages were being registered as spam by my own server so deleted before they could be received to my recipients.

Had my DNS settings changed as recommended, I don't have any firewall activated and can send emails just fine through outlook online but not through thunderbird. Fasthost have checked all of the Thunderbird settings for me and they're all correct?

I've changed my passwords and logged back in.

I run the business on this email account and am now struggling so much because of it - please help!

title: Mailboxes erased randomly in Thunderbird
content: I have been using Thunderbird for over 15 years without any problem. Two email addreses are managed by Thunderbird. My emails are classified in about 200 folders. I use Thunderbird on 3 computers and all my messages and folders are synchronized via Dropbox. Starting about 6 months ago, messages have started disappearing. Some new folders have started getting duplicated. For example, FolderXX was duplicated as FolderXX-1 with only recent meassages in FolderXX-1. Most recently, some folders have been emptied of all their messages with only the last message remaining. This message loss is a real problem. Could it be due to a recent problem with Thunderbird, or a problem with Dropbox, or an incompatibility between Thunderbird and Dropbox ? Thanks for any help Florent Domine

Cheers! Chris
